turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Kamandi.
turn.1: What was the great disaster that was referenced in Kamandi's story?
turn.2: "The Warlord" tie OMAC to both the storyline of "Hercules Unbound" and to the Atomic Knights, indicating that the Great Disaster was the atomic war of 1986 that precipitated the events of the latter. " Superman" #295 (Jan.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: 1976) implied that the Great Disaster was a natural occurrence.
turn.5: Was anything ever made of it?
turn.6: "DC Comics Presents" #57 (May 1983) reveals that the events of the Atomic Knights stories were a fantasy in the mind of Gardner Grayle, but "DC Comics Presents" #64 and "Crisis on Infinite Earths" #2 make clear that Kamandi still existed in an alternate future of Earth-One.
turn.8: In the wake of the Crisis on Infinite Earths, the Great Disaster did not occur, and the boy who would have become Kamandi instead became Tommy Tomorrow.
turn.9: Did anything else come of it?
turn.10: In the aftermath of the "Infinite Crisis" limited series, a bunker named "Command D" has been built under the ruins of the city of Blüdhaven.
turn.11: Was anyone else referenced in the story?
turn.12: In early 2007, DC Nation house ads showed a partial picture of Darkseid and mention a "Great Disaster".
